result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D Morris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 48 months.

superMiscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Submit DNA sample and pay assessed $250 surcharge if DOC has a sample on file.  Comply with Child Support and Family Court orders.  Cooperate with treatment, counseling and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until setence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

supervisions.notes: Extended supervision may be transferred to Michigan if they will accept the transfer.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony D Morris

Charges:  Ct 2: 961.41(1m)(h)2-Poss w/intent THC.  Ct. 1 was dismissed.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
